Very minimalistic. But that can be a good thing. I was hoping for more features and customizations, but this one is clean, ad-free, cost-free, and very small size, so no worries about storage space. Thank you very much kind person, for creating this app! <3

Works well for me. Simple to use. Just share the file is probably easiest but you can also pick the file. Shortcut may need moving to a folder of your choice just the same as with other installed programs. Thanks to the developer for this helpful app.
IT is only file shortcut app. Folder shortcut is not possible. Shortcut of image file is opening but pdf files can not be opened, insufficient permission is displyed.
It is working only for one shortcut
Works great! I quickly created a desktop shortcut to a web page. You can also create shortcuts to files on your phone. Worked perfectly my first time out. (Using Samsung Galaxy S9+)

Does what it says on the tin, creates a shortcut to a file. You just need to make sure that the file type you are linking to has an associated app. I have oneplus 5 running android 9
Very good app. Worth the name. I would buy a cup of Coffee for the developer

Can put individual files and folders on your home screen... Simple as that!.. (tap on "open file pickers" to find your file.. It fills the "file path" in automatically when you select your file)

Simple & Works! My build-in file manager, which I like, won't let me name/rename its shortcuts. To rename with this app, just create new shortcut and delete the old. Duh! Custom icons are a real plus. Thanks!!!
Excellent
Good app

This app saves me a great deal of time. Rather than always searching for a file, I can simply use it to find a file I need (like a PDF document) and make a shortcut to the home screen. So instead of the frantically searching and continuous clicking, I can access the file I need with one simple action. It is an ideal time saver. I use the older version on my old devices and the new version [V2] on my newer ones. Top marks to the developers.
Crashes when you try to create any shortcut with any item. Useless and broken
Disappointing: App crashes each time I attempt to select the target file. I'm on a Samsung S10+
Shortcuts don't work anymore
Nice

Quick and easy and does exactly what it says. I had a file widget app already but it took up 28 MB! There's no reason such a simple function should take up that much space. This app only shows 3MB as installed. I uninstalled the other app. Also, I prefer the sizing of the home icon on this app because it's the same size as my app icons. The other one put a big icon on my home page.
Use it u r self NONSENSE app
Does exactly what I need
Simple and does exactly what I needed it to do! I spent a few hours trying to figure out how to add a shortcut to a picture file I use as a reference. This app took a few seconds to do it on my S9.
Easy to use!

This app like most so called shortcuts app is stupid because it can only do what the operating system already provided. What l really want is to be able to store the shortcuts in a folder. That way l can organise them. What's the point of putting it at the desktop. You can do it without some dumb app.
